description: Character registry for German Learning App content. Minimizes cognitive load while enabling realistic scenarios.

primary.description: Default characters for 2-person dialogues. Use these FIRST for all basic scenarios.

Lisa.role: German native speaker, friendly and patient

Theo.role: German native speaker, curious and helpful

primary.usageRule: ALWAYS use Lisa & Theo when only 2 people are needed

secondary.description: Use when 3rd or 4th person is needed in a scene (e.g., introducing someone, family scenes).
secondary.usageRule: Only add secondary characters when scene requires more than 2 people

persian.description: Persian-speaking characters for cultural bridge moments and relatable learner perspective.

Sara.role: Persian speaker learning German, relatable learner perspective

Amir.role: Persian speaker living in Germany, cultural bridge

persian.usageRule: Use for Persian cultural perspective or when showing learner struggles

service.description: Generic role names for service scenarios (not named characters).
service.usageRule: Use role titles instead of names for brief service interactions

selection.threePersonScene: Use Lisa, Theo + one from secondary
selection.fourPersonScene: Use Lisa, Theo + two from secondary
selection.persianPerspective: Use Sara or Amir when showing learner experience
selection.serviceInteraction: Use role titles (Kellner, etc.) instead of names

A1.note: Keep character count minimal for beginners

A2.note: Can introduce more complex multi-person scenarios

B1.note: Full character roster available, learners can handle complexity

validationRules.description: Fail if character name not in registry
Warn if more than 4 characters in a scene
Warn if secondary character used before A1-M02
Warn if 3+ characters used when 2 would suffice
